question.text: Which one of the following is the correct match of events occurring during the menstrual cycle?

options.text: Menstruation: Breakdown of myometrium & ovum not fertilized
Proliferative phase: Rapid regeneration of myometrium & maturation of Graafian follicle
Development of corpus luteum: Secretory phase & increased secretion of progesterone
Ovulation: LH and FSH attain peak level & sharp fall in the secretion of progesterone

solution.text: The secretory phase is also called as the luteal phase. The luteinising hormone or LH is secreted by the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland. LH causes ovulation. LH stimulates cells of ovarian follicles to develop corpus luteum. Corpus luteum secretes a large amount of progesterone.
